name: Senior Financial Data Analyst
description:
About Craft:

Craft (https://craft.co) is building the ‘Source of Truth’ on companies, mapping the global economy, and delivering cutting-edge business intelligence to professionals globally. Craft collects, aggregates and curates financial, operating and human capital data to provide the deepest picture of private and public companies to assist decision-makers to manage their supply chain, maximize their investments, mitigate risks, grow their sales, leverage their talent and enhance their competitive position. Current clients include Fortune 100 companies, SMEs, hedge funds, and others.

Our HQ is in San Francisco, with offices in Boston, London, and Minsk, Belarus. Our team has previously worked at Venrock (venture capital), Goldman Sachs, SugarCRM, Crunchyroll, Cisco and Juniper with degrees from Carnegie Mellon, Columbia and Stanford. We are funded by leading venture capital fund Uncork Capital.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Job Description

Craft is seeking a Senior Financial Data Specialist to join our growing team in Minsk, Belarus. The role is focused on the supervision of the team of financial data analysts, curating and validating financial data and content relating to companies, industry sectors and jobs for publication on the Craft website.

In this role you will

  • Create and execute recurring tasks fulfillment plans
  • Review and evaluate other team members’ performance
  • Allocate resources throughout the project(s)
  • Identify issues and gaps in the process and drive improvements
  • Gather and review financial data, as well as monitor and improve data quality throughout the platform
  • Research and complete topical analyses on companies and sectors, e.g. team composition, financial and operational metrics analysis on selected sector groups
  • Proactively identify and recommend improvements to content creation profile throughout the team, for development and implementation by the technology team

We’d love to hear from you if you have

  • Excellent interpersonal skills to productively coordinate other team members
  • Strong organizational and time management skills to meet time-sensitive deadlines and expectations from clients and internal stakeholders
  • Proven problem-solving and decision-making skills
  • Attention to detail and system thinking
  • Very good/Excellent written and spoken English (B2+)
  • Strong computer skills, e.g. experience with spreadsheets (e.g. Excel or Google Sheets)

Personal Attributes

  • Energetic and entrepreneurial mindset
  • Leadership qualities
  • Ability to overcome challenges and constraints
  • Desire to go above and beyond
  • Ability to balance priorities and strong execution skills
  • Comfortable executing with little oversight to drive results
  • Adaptability and ability to think forward

Additional Information

We have offices in Silicon Valley, London and Minsk, and venture funding from leading technology investors in Silicon Valley and the UK.
